error.missingbinding: No keybinding is set up for this action.
gmcm.controls.trigger.deadzone.tooltip: Helps prevent accidental triggering on very sensitive or inaccurate controllers.
gmcm.controls.trigger.swap.tooltip: Show items with the right trigger and shortcuts with the left trigger.
gmcm.controls.thumbstick.preference.tool: Choose which thumbstick controls the menu selection.
gmcm.controls.thumbstick.deadzone.toolti: Corrects for inaccuracy or drift on thumbsticks for many controllers.
gmcm.controls.action.primary.tooltip: The action to perform when the Primary Activation Method is used. Note: 'Consume/Use' will fall back to 'Select' for non-consumable, non-usable items.
gmcm.controls.action.secondary.tooltip: The action to perform when the Secondary Action Button is pressed.
gmcm.controls.action.secondary.button.to: Button used to perform the Secondary Action. Must be a regular key binding.
gmcm.controls.activation.tooltip: Which input performs the primary action on the selected item?
gmcm.controls.activation.delay.tooltip: Delay between the trigger (button press/release) and the actual activation. Raise this if you're getting accidental character or cursor movements after selecting an item.
gmcm.controls.activation.delay.actions.t: Limit which actions get delayed. Since actions other than tool-switching (e.g. eating food, using warp totem, etc.) play their own animations, the delay usually isn't necessary for those.
gmcm.inventory.max.tooltip: Maximum number of items to show in the inventory menu. Empty slots are counted against the limit, but not displayed.
gmcm.custom.link.tooltip: Choose which shortcuts will appear in the right-trigger menu.
gmcm.custom.intro: The custom menu lets you add shortcuts to key bindings from other mods or from the base game. When you activate one of these shortcuts, it will "press" the associated keys, so you can access them by controller without needing a dedicated button.
gmcm.custom.count.tooltip: Number of items that will show up in the custom menu. You'll have to configure these items below, in order for them to display a unique icon or do anything useful.
gmcm.custom.item.default.name: Unnamed Shortcut
gmcm.custom.item.name: Title
gmcm.custom.item.name.tooltip: Title text to display in the preview area (inner circle) when this item is selected.
gmcm.custom.item.description.tooltip: Description text to display underneath the title in the preview area (inner circle) when this item is selected.
gmcm.custom.item.keybind.tooltip: The keybinding that will be simulated when this shortcut is used; must match the binding used by the game or mod function you want to associate.
gmcm.custom.item.synced.all: Title, Description and Keybinding are automatically synced to the configuration of {{modName}}. To use a custom Title and Description, check the {{overrideOptionName}} box.
gmcm.custom.item.synced.onlykeybind: You are using a custom Title and Description. Keybinding is automatically synced to the configuration of {{modName}}.
gmcm.custom.item.image.type.tooltip: Specifies how to obtain the image that will be shown in the ring for this item.
gmcm.custom.item.image.item.tooltip: Choose the item whose icon will be used to represent this shortcut.
gmcm.custom.item.image.assetpath.tooltip: Path to the texture relative to the game data, like 'maps/spring_town'.
gmcm.custom.item.image.sourcerect.toolti: The portion of the entire sprite sheet where the specific image is located, in the form (X, Y, Width, Height).
gmcm.custom.item.gmcm.note: You can associate this shortcut with another mod's keybinding in GMCM, which will keep it in sync if the other mod's settings change. To use this feature, the other mod must support GMCM and use it for keybinding settings.
gmcm.custom.item.gmcm.mod.tooltip: The mod that will handle this shortcut. Only mods supporting GMCM will be listed here; for other mods, you must set the key binding manually.
gmcm.custom.item.gmcm.action.tooltip: The other mod's action that this shortcut should trigger. The mod must have registered it as a keybind option in GMCM for it to show up here.
gmcm.custom.item.gmcm.override.tooltip: If checked, the text entered above for Title and Description will persist; otherwise, those fields will be automatically set to the mod name and field label in GMCM.
gmcm.style.link.tooltip: Change the colors and dimensions of the menus.
gmcm.style.colors.slidernote: Colors are displayed as hex values (#rrggbb or #aarrggbb). For a better editing experience, install the 'GMCM Options' mod by Jamie Taylor.
gmcm.style.colors.inner.tooltip: Background color for the inner area showing detailed item info.
gmcm.style.colors.outer.tooltip: Background color for the ring where items/shortcuts appear.
gmcm.style.colors.selection.tooltip: Background color for the part of the ring containing the tool your farmer was holding before opening the menu.
gmcm.style.colors.highlight.tooltip: Background color for the part of the ring that is selected / about to be activated.
gmcm.style.colors.cursor.tooltip: Color of the cursor icon showing the precise stick direction.
gmcm.style.colors.title: Selection Title
gmcm.style.colors.title.tooltip: Color of the selection title displayed in large text inside the inner ring.
gmcm.style.colors.description.tooltip: Color of the selection description displayed in small text underneath the title.
gmcm.style.dimensions.note: These configure the sizes of different parts of the menu, but can't be shown in the preview above. You generally don't need to change these unless you're playing in windowed mode or have an unusual display resolution.
gmcm.style.dimensions.inner.tooltip: Radius of the inner area showing detailed item info.
gmcm.style.dimensions.outer.tooltip: Radius of the outer ring where items/shortcuts appear. This is the distance from the inside edge to the outside edge, not the radius from the menu's center.
gmcm.style.dimensions.gap.tooltip: Space between the inner circle and outer ring. This is purely an aesthetic choice and won't affect legibility.
gmcm.style.dimensions.cursor.size.toolti: Size of the cursor showing current stick direction; measured from base to tip of the triangle.
gmcm.style.dimensions.cursor.distance.to: Distance between the tip of the stick direction cursor and the edge of the ring.
gmcm.style.dimensions.itemheight.tooltip: Height of selectable icons/images displayed in the outer ring. Very wide aspect ratios may be scaled down further to fit.
gmcm.style.dimensions.selectionheight.to: Height of the icon/image of the selected item, displayed above the title in the inner ring.
